concept.title: Namespace Header Attributes with the Hive Drift Solution

conbody.p: JDBC namespace header attributesusing with the Hive Drift SolutionHive Drift SolutionUsing the JDBC Consumer namespace header attributesWhen you use the JDBC Consumer as part of the Hive Drift Solution, configure the origin to create JDBC namespace header attributes.
Creating JDBC namespace header attributes allows the Hive Metadata processor to use the precision and scale attributes to define decimal fields.

To enable the Hive Metadata processor to define decimal fields as needed, perform the following steps:
In the JDBC Consumer, on the Advanced tab, select Create JDBC Namespace Headers.
On the same tab, you can optionally configure JDBC Header Prefix.
In the Hive Metadata processor, if necessary, configure the Decimal Precision Expression and Decimal Scale Expression properties on the Hive tab.
If you changed the default value for JDBC Header Prefix, then update the "jdbc." string in the expression to use the specified JDBC Header Prefix.
If you did not change the JDBC Header Prefix default value, then use the default expressions for the properties.
